content:
Diagnosis:		Extensive stage small cell lung cancer, right middle lobe primary with liver and brain metastases

Management:		Completed 6 cycles carboplatin/etoposide March-July 2023
		Whole brain radiotherapy 20Gy/5# completed August 2023

Current Status:	Disease progression with new liver lesions and neurological deterioration

[redacted name] has unfortunately shown clear evidence of disease progression on recent imaging. CT chest/abdomen/pelvis from 15/10/23 demonstrates enlargement of the primary right middle lobe mass from 4.2cm to 5.8cm, with multiple new liver metastases. The largest liver lesion in segment 7 measures 4.5cm. MRI brain from 18/10/23 shows progression of previously treated metastases with increasing perilesional edema.

She has experienced significant clinical deterioration over the past 3 weeks with increasing confusion, right-sided weakness, and difficulty maintaining oral intake. Her performance status has declined from ECOG 2 to 3-4. She requires assistance with most activities of daily living and is now spending >50% of time in bed. She reports increasing right upper quadrant discomfort requiring regular breakthrough oxycodone.

Given her poor performance status and early progression following first-line platinum-based chemotherapy, I have had a detailed discussion with [redacted name] and her family about focusing on symptom control rather than further systemic anti-cancer therapy. They understand this recommendation and agree with prioritizing quality of life.

I have increased her dexamethasone to 8mg twice daily and arranged urgent palliative care review. She will be referred to the hospital palliative care team and local hospice for ongoing support. We will continue to provide oncology support as needed but will transition primary care to the palliative team. I have prescribed additional breakthrough analgesia and anti-emetics, and arranged district nurse involvement for support at home.
